title: American_Top_40_1971_January_31st
description:
"This is Casey Kasem, and it's the top songs from the Atlantic Coast to Waikiki Beach that we count down every week on American Top 40."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

When this countdown aired, one song was by a man who lived 1800 miles away from his regular job. Each week he flew from Nashville to Hollywood to work on The Glen Campbell Goodtime Hour.

There is a song that pairs the Supremes and the Four Tops, "River Deep - Mountain High" (at number 29).

There is a six-man band in the countdown whose members play guitar, harmonica, and mandolin, but that's not all. Casey says they also play banjo, kazoo, washboard, comb, sandbox, and bubbles.

Only two recording acts have had hits named "Top Single of the Year" more than once. One was The Beatles, and Casey spotlights the other in an extra.

Casey also plays and extra showcasing the only act besides The Beatles whose first two albums sold a combined total of 8 million albums.

And "One Bad Apple" by The Osmonds (at number 9) leaps 25 notches to land in the top 10.
